function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Varying success rates of policies based on location, density, and cultural practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of research on pandemic governance.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation of the study to only architectural, urban, and public realm scales.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"People not following covid-19 protocols such as maintaining six feet distance and other health protocols","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological difficulty in making people follow the protocols","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Congestion and lack of social distancing in urban spaces and social gathering areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of pandemic-resistant urban design recommendations","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure of measures due to lack of consideration for cultural beliefs and practices","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Evolution of crisis leading to uncertain conclusions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Congregations in public spaces increase the risk of virus transmission due to close contact and crowded environments.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on physical presence for the functioning of public spaces creates a challenge in controlling virus transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic impact of a complete lockdown creates pressure to design and build resilient public spaces to withstand future pandemics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Promoting development horizontally and maintaining lower density","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusive urban planning and management of multi-functional public spaces over preventive design strategies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Intermixing of public realms, social spaces, and green infrastructure","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in public transportation usage leading to increased use of private vehicles","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in online shopping leading to reduced physical footfall in retail spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical distancing in public spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of public spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of urban design to promote physical distancing","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on online shopping as a result of in-person shopping limitations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Link between average income, age group, and virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges of stay-at-home orders in neighborhoods without public or private open spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Zone-based lockdown for covid-19 suppression","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for pandemic consequences in architectural and urban design education","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in social behavior and neighborhood dynamics due to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Horizontal expansion and decentralization can lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases due to greater connectivity between different areas.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in income and class can lead to unequal access to safe public spaces and increased vulnerability to contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High-density districts and crowded urban areas can lead to higher morbidity rates of covid-19 and increased vulnerability among older people and men.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased immunity due to physical inactivity and social distancing measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for increased disease transmission in densely populated areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on socio-economic composition of cities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High density urban areas facilitating easier transmission of communicable diseases due to increased social contact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate management of multi-functional public spaces leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overcrowding due to concentration of amenities leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Urban spaces not designed for pandemic mitigation norms and regulations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Questioning the effectiveness of 6 feet physical distancing in urban spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerability of architectural practices in accommodating pandemic procedures","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High concentration of covid-19 cases in a major wholesale market.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure of alternative options to mitigate the transmission of the virus.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for post-pandemic behaviors in public spaces.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in following physical distancing norms in urban public spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to enforce public norms and regulations in heavily dense urban areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic impact of shutting down public spaces in densely populated areas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global pandemic of covid-19 causing daily loss of lives and economic downturn","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased transmissibility of sars-cov-2 variants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological aversion to big crowds and necessary changes in public spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate air circulation and natural light may lead to high humidity, increasing the risk of viruses sticking and spreading easily.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inflexible layout design may lead to inadequate access to daylight and natural light, impacting the overall health and well-being of occupants.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient separation of wet and living spaces may lead to increased risk of cross-contamination and spread of pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
